fields.headline: Squad sheets: Stevenage v Reading
fields.bodyText: Stevenage are aiming to reach the fifth round for the first time and this will be only the second time that the League Two side have been involved at this stage. Their memorable toppling of Newcastle has been followed by a decent run of results. Reading are also showing impressive form – with striker Shane Long being the key man. Brian McDermott's team, quarter-finalists last year, play some of the prettiest football in the Championship. Stevenage need to make this a physical battle to stand a chance. Arindam Rej Venue Broadhall Way, Saturday 3pm Ref A Taylor Odds Stevenage 12-5 Reading 6-5 Draw 12-5 Head to head N/A Stevenage Subs from Bayes, Charles, Foster, Griffin, Daley, Long, Maamria, Odubade, Mousinho Doubtful Long, Mousinho, Odubade Cup-tied Harrison Reading Subs from McCarthy, Church, Tabb, Antonio, Pearce, Armstrong, Howard, Cummings, Taylor, Robson-Kanu, Khizanishvili Doubtful Howard, Pearce Cup-tied Manset, Morrison, Williams Match pointer Reading have not been knocked out by a team from outside the top two divisions since York City beat them 2-0 at Bootham Crescent in the second round in December 2001.
